data.question: What is the molecular formula of the compound 1b?
Which ligand was used to produce the 1:1 type of product under all experimental conditions tested?
Is the compound 6a a bis-adduct type structure?
What is the highest π-bond order calculated for acenaphthylene (L1) according to Hückel theory?
Does the compound 9c exhibit a 2D network structure?
What is the main variable in the experiments for synthesizing various adducts?
Are all the adducts with polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) stable in air at ambient conditions?
What is the role of dirhodium(II) tetra(trifluoroacetate) in the formation of supramolecular assemblies?
data.answer: It acts as a powerful Lewis acid and acceptor.

data.question: Which ligand affords two adducts with 1:1 and 1:2 ratios of Rh2 to L?
Is the coordination of the ligand through 'internal' carbon atoms observed in all structures?
What is the yield range of crystalline products from the reactions studied?
Does the compound 8c have a pseudo-2D structure?
What is the main factor determining the selection of initial temperature conditions for the synthesis?
Are the IR spectra of all products dominated by broad C−O stretching vibrations of trifluoroacetate groups?
What is the experimental technique used for the synthesis of various adducts?
data.answer: Sublimation−deposition of the volatile Lewis acid, dirhodium(II) tetra(trifluoroacetate), in the presence of various PAHs

data.question: Does the compound 9c use all four C−C bonds of chrysene for coordination?
What is the role of Hückel calculations in understanding the construction of solid-state materials?
data.answer: They are used to calculate π-electron densities for the C−C bonds and compare these densities to the experimental results.

data.question: Are the Rh−C contacts in the range of 2.53−2.65 Å for all structures?
What is the significance of the Rh−Rh distances in the dirhodium complex?
data.answer: They span a narrow range of 2.425−2.431 Å, indicating the stability of the dirhodium complex.

data.question: Is the correlation between points of attachment and calculated π-density maxima good for all PAHs?
